title: Setting Up
text: Set up three equatinos in variable form to represent the situation $$(c=children$$ tickets, $$s=student$$ tickets, and $$a=adult$$ tickets). We have $$c+s+a=1175$$, $$22.5c+20s+29a=28112.5$$, and $$2c=a$$.

title: Simplifying to 1 Variable
text: Rearrange $$3c+s=1175$$ to isolate s and plug in the expresion for s into the equation containing the total price of tickets. Plug in $$a=2c$$ into the total price of tickets equation so that the final equation only has one variable c.

title: Solve for c
text: Using algebra solve for c, the number of childrens tickets sold

title: Solve for s
text: Plug in the value of c into $$3c+s=1175$$ and solve for s, number of student tickets sold

title: Solve for p
text: Plug in the value of c and s into any equatino containing p to solve for the number of parent tickets sold
